recipe.title: Vanilla Poached Rhubarb
recipe.description: the rhubarb collapses into a pulpy mass which is delicious spooned over yoghurt, served with porridge or spooned into a champagne glass and topped up with a little prosecco or cava.
recipe.directions: Place the sugar and rhubarb in a saucepan. Scrape the seeds from the vanilla bean into the sugar and add the water and the empty vanilla bean pod. Bring the mixture to the boil and simmer gently for 25 minutes until the rhubarb is soft and pulpy. If there is still a lot of water in the pot, increase the heat slightly and cook for another 5-10 minutes until thickened. Remove the pot from the heat and allow to cool until just above room temperature. Remove the empty vanilla pod halves and serve as desired. >
